title: Ticket #6329: Add *** as valid delimiter in classad.parseAds method
description:
If using the classad.parseAds method to parse a file with ClassAds delimited by "***" (e.g. log files used by condor_history), only the first ad will be parsed before the iterator stops. No exceptions are raised (at least by default).

Example code: 

import classad

# delimited by newline
ad_text = '''AdNumber = 1

AdNumber = 2

AdNumber = 3'''

ads = classad.parseAds(ad_text, classad.Parser.Old)
print '=== parsing with newline delimiter ==='
for ad in ads:
    print ad

# ====

# delimited by ***
print '=== parsing with *** delimiter ==='
ad_text = '''AdNumber = 1
***
AdNumber = 2
***
AdNumber = 3
***'''

ads = classad.parseAds(ad_text, classad.Parser.Old)
for ad in ads:
    print ad

Example output: 

$ python quick_parse.py
=== parsing with newline delimiter ===

    [
        AdNumber = 1
    ]

    [
        AdNumber = 2
    ]

    [
        AdNumber = 3
    ]
=== parsing with *** delimiter ===

    [
        AdNumber = 3
    ]
remarks:
2017-Jul-03 09:18:48 by bbockelm:
Please make sure to add unit tests when doing this work!
creator: jpatton
